t: Awake,*pn awake! Put*ld on your strength, O Zion; Put*ld on your beautiful garments, O*ld Jerusalem, the holy city! For*ld the uncircumcised and the unclean Shall*ld no longer come to you.
Shake*ld yourself from the dust, arise; Sit*ld down, O Jerusalem! Loose*ld yourself from the bonds of your neck, O*ld captive daughter of Zion!
For*p thus says the Lord:*s “You*pn have sold yourselves for nothing, And*ld you shall be redeemed without money.”
For*p thus says the Lord God:*s “My*pn people went down at first Into*ld Egypt to dwell there; Then*ld the Assyrian oppressed them without cause.

Now*ld therefore, what have I here,” says the Lord,*s “That*ld My people are taken away for nothing? Those*ld who rule over them Make*ld them wail,” says the Lord,*s “And*ld My name is*i blasphemed continually every day.
Therefore*ld My people shall know My name; Therefore*ld they*i shall*i know*i in that day That*ld I am*i He who speaks: ‘Behold,*ld it*i is*i I.’”

How*ln beautiful upon the mountains Are*ld the feet of him who brings good news, Who*ld proclaims peace, Who*ld brings glad tidings of good things,*i Who*ld proclaims salvation, Who*ld says to Zion, “Your*ld God reigns!”
Your*ld watchmen shall lift up their*i voices, With*ld their voices they shall sing together; For*ld they shall see eye to eye When*ld the Lord*s brings back Zion.
Break*ld forth into joy, sing together, You*ld waste places of Jerusalem! For*ld the Lord*s has comforted His people, He*ld has redeemed Jerusalem.
The*ld Lord*s has made bare His holy arm In*ld the eyes of all the nations; And*ld all the ends of the earth shall see The*ld salvation of our God.
Depart!*ln Depart! Go out from there, Touch*ld no unclean thing;*i Go*ld out from the midst of her, Be*ld clean, You*ld who bear the vessels of the Lord.*s
For*ld you shall not go out with haste, Nor*ld go by flight; For*ld the Lord*s will go before you, And*ld the God of Israel will*i be*i your rear guard.
Behold,*pn My Servant shall deal prudently; He*ld shall be exalted and extolled and be very high.
Just*ld as many were astonished at you, So*ld His visage was marred more than any man, And*ld His form more than the sons of men;
So*ld shall He sprinkle many nations. Kings*ld shall shut their mouths at Him; For*ld what had not been told them they shall see, And*ld what they had not heard they shall consider.
